Name: Description
Life Expectancy by Neighborhood Poverty:
Life expectancy at birth by the percent of residents in neighborhood poverty. 
Neighborhood poverty is defined as the percent of respondents with incomes below 100% of the Federal Poverty Level by census tract, as follows: 
Very high = 30% or more of people 
High = 20 to 30% of people 
Medium = 10 to 20% of people
Low = Less than 10%

Name: Source Notes
Life Expectancy by Neighborhood Poverty: New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, Bureau of Vital Statistics, Summary of Vital Statistics (2004, 2006-2008, 2013, 2015-2017); retrieved from https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/data/vital-statistics/vital-statistics-summary.page

Name: Notes
Life Expectancy by Neighborhood Poverty: Data on life expectancy by the percent of residents in poverty are unavailable in the public vital statistics tables for 2005, 2009, 2010-12, and 2014. CCC will update these data with these missing year if and when they are available.
